definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]

sentences.english: Most Chinese restaurants in New Zealand feature Cantonese cuisineadapted to Western tastes.
sentences.chinese: 新西蘭大多數中餐館都是適合西方人口味的廣東菜。

sentences.english: We have Yangzhou fried rice in Chinese restaurants back in the U. K.
sentences.chinese: 在英國的中餐館裏，我們就有揚州炒飯。

sentences.english: I hear Chinese restaurants serve very good food.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說中餐館的飯菜非常好喫。

sentences.english: I've been working in the Chinese restaurant in Furama Hotel for 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 我在富麗華飯店的中餐館已經工作十年了。

sentences.english: The weblog is your local Chinese take-out, delivering your favorite spicy dish.
sentences.chinese: 網絡日誌是當地的中餐館，爲您獻上喜愛的風味菜餚。

sentences.english: Mike, you ought to try the potstickers at that little Chinese restaurant on New York Avenue.
sentences.chinese: 邁克，你得上紐約大街那個小中餐館試試。

sentences.english: So how did they go from being something Japanese to something served in Chinese restaurants?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，日式幸運餅又是如何在中餐館大行其道的呢？

sentences.english: This may well account for the universal popularity of Chinese restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 這足以說明中餐館在全世界受歡迎的原因。

sentences.english: The Browns go to a Chinese restaurant with their Chinese friends Lin Kun and his wife.
sentences.chinese: 布朗一家人和他們的中國朋友林昆夫婦到中餐館用餐。

definition: Brooklyn, borough of New York City
Queens, one of the five boroughs of New York City
(Tw) San Diego, California/Santiago, capital of Chile
